file_content.text: Without the Forge, the Jedi lose their martial power. You must stop Nalen before he destroys it.
I thought you intended to destroy the Jedi. You attacked the Council.
Isn't this what you wanted?
I sought to cleanse them, to begin anew. Nalen wants only ashes.
Master Yuon hasn't discussed this "Forge" with me.
What is the Forge?
In my time, it crafted our blades and scientific instruments. Now, lightsabers are created there.
Perhaps I can correct your mistake.
And clean up your mess.
That weapon won't suffice against Nalen. But you carry the hilt of the first blade--an old friend.
A simple procedure would convert it to a working lightsaber hilt. And perhaps a crystal from the Forge caves to power it, given its age.
I appreciate your guidance, Master Rajivari.
Thank you for your help.
Finally, I will carry the weapon of a Jedi.
At last. A lightsaber.
So where is the Forge?
Pass through the caves, and seek the Forge at the mountain's summit. Stop Nalen, this... abomination my knowledge has created.
I understand what's at stake, and what you've made. I'll find him.
If it must be done.
Master Rajivari, you've held on to this existence for thousands of years. Perhaps it's time for it to end.
I'd like to help you pass on.
Ah, child. You see only what the Jedi are. But I saw what could have been.
My colleagues wouldn't listen. I spoke of strength; they cowered. I spoke of a golden age; they chattered of overstepping ourselves.
It will happen. Someday, the right acolyte will carry my vision.
Those ideas drove you to betray the Council, your friends. And what about your apprentices?
Your vision led to suffering.
My... apprentices. Yes. Cahel--always wiser than his age. And Vadria, and Orth.
You thought Nalen Raloch was the right acolyte. Now he's a threat to everything you helped to create.
Another Nalen? You idiot.
But... but you followed. There will be others. What is waiting to me?
It took many powerful Jedi to stop you, Master Rajivari. Those who survived were clearly worthy to survive any challenge.
You already made us stronger.
I remember that battle. My friends. My death.
You speak of things I had long put aside.
You were a great man once. You deserve more than this ruin and your memories.
I can see how you suffer.
If you stay, you are no more than an echo of the past. But if you let go, you will always be a Jedi.
How will you be remembered?
If our future is to be worthwhile, we Jedi must find it ourselves. You know this.
The Jedi's fate is our own.
I... gave my dream to Nalen Raloch. And I saw a horror. Perhaps... it was always so.
Please. Stop him. Correct my last mistake.
You must succeed. You are proof the Jedi did not lose their way after all.
My mind is stronger than Nalen's. I could be the acolyte you wanted: use your device on me.
Give me your wisdom instead.
I... cannot. The devices were spent during Nalen's procedure.
You may take a small token from these laboratories, if you wish. Perhaps one day, you will be ready.
Go. Stop Nalen, before he destroys the Jedi Order. Someday, I will see it saved.
Of course, here is the other. Seekers of forbidden knowledge always have their pursuers.
If you came for Nalen Raloch, he has been and gone. So much is fleeting. But I remain. And I remain the man I was. Rajivari.
You can't be alive. The Council struck you down thousands of years ago.
How is this possible?
This is no hologram...
This place is full of shadows and traps. You could be another.
I can't trust anything here.
Small hunter, who is you speak to? Smell nothing. Or... must be Jedi seeing. Not for my eyes.
Your pet is brighter than he looks.
When my body failed me, I refused to become one with the Force. How could I? The Jedi were still imperfect.
Here, in my laboratory, I had refined certain... devices. I could give one chosen apprentice decades of experience in a day. An apprentice, to become worthy to carry my vision.
Your wisdom and knowledge were preserved through you and these devices you created.
You are the Fount of Rajivari.
I have waited, for new acolytes. I... believed Nalen Raloch was a suitable candidate.
You said Nalen came here.
What about Nalen Raloch?
Yes. Nalen. I had such hopes when he arrived.
Your students trusted you, and you used them. They deserved better.
No "vision" is worth that.
Those apprentices were like my own children! Gifted, loyal--I hoped this Nalen Raloch might succeed them.
But... disappointment. Nalen walked through the traps instead of solving them. He suffered greatly.
You, at least, survived with your mind intact. Nalen, alas, did not.
Now Nalen is... changed.
Can anything be done for Nalen?
Maybe I can save him.
Possible, but doubtful.
I know the knowledge he gathered was twisting his mind.
He was already changing.
Nalen's condition makes no difference, I just need to find him.
I only care about where he is.
I... miscalculated. Nalen's mind wasn't equal to the wisdom he demanded. I have made... not a successor, but a monster.
Nalen will not remake the Jedi; he wishes to destroy them and everything else on this world. Beginning with the great Forge, where lightsabers are made.
